Package Model

Class Status

java.lang.Object
Model.Status
public class Status
extends java.lang.Object
Status holds all the additional information of a player.

Also referred to as "Other Player Information", this contains all the other player info aside from the basic ones such as cash and loan. Specifically, this class contains the Career Card, Salary Card, House Card, Degree Status, Marriage Status, Retirement Status, Current Salary, Current Tax, Pay Raise Amount, and Family Peg Amount of a player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Status

      public Status()
      The sole constructor of this class. Allocates a new Status object (creates a new Status).

  • Method Details

    • payRaise

      public boolean payRaise()
      Increases a player's salary based on his available pay raise amount, current pay raise amount, and Salary Card attributes. This also checks if a player can have a pay raise.
      Returns:
      true if the player's salary has been successfully increased; false otherise

    • graduate

      public void graduate()
      Gives the player a degree. With a degree, a player will be able to take careers that requires it.

    • marry

      public boolean marry()
      Makes the player married. By being married, a player will be able to have children in the game. This also checks if a player is already married, as there may be multiple spaces for marriage in the game.
      Returns:
      true if the player married successfully; false otherwise.

    • retire

      public void retire()
      Makes the player retired. By being retired, the player will not be given a turn in the rotation. This is used at the end of the game when the player reaches the retirement tile.

    • addFamily

      public boolean addFamily​(int amt)
      Adds children under the player. This also checks if the player already has the maximum amount of children possible.
      Parameters:
      amt - the amount of family pegs to be added
      Returns:
      true if the children were successfully added under the player; false otherwise.

    • setCareerCard

      public boolean setCareerCard​(CareerCard card)
      Assigns a Career Card to the player. This also checks if the player already has a degree, for some careers requires it. If a player has an existing Career Card, this will disown it so that it can be reused in the game. If the player meets the requirements for the career, this will assign the Career Card to the player. Once a Career Card is assigned to a player, this will set is as owned so that no other player can acquire it anymore.
      Parameters:
      card - the career card to be assigned
      Returns:
      true if the Career Card was assigned successfully; false otherwise

    • setSalaryCard

      public void setSalaryCard​(SalaryCard card)
      Assigns a Salary Card to the player. A Salary Card will be successfully assigned to a player once they meet the requirements for the Career Card that they have drawn. This will also set the Salary Card as owned so that no other players can acquire this card. If the player has an existing Salary Card, this will disown it so that it can be reused in the game.
      Parameters:
      card - the salary card to be assigned

    • setHouseCard

      public void setHouseCard​(HouseCard card)
      Assigns a House Card to the player. This will also set the House Card as owned so that no other player can acquire it anymore.
      Parameters:
      card - the house card to be assigned

    • getCareerCard

      public CareerCard getCareerCard()
      Returns the Career Card the player currently possesses.

      the Career Card the player possesses

      Returns:
      true if the player has a college degree; false otherwise

      Returns:
      true if the player is married; false otherwise

    • isRetired

      public boolean isRetired()
      Returns the retirement status of the player.
      Returns:
      true if the player is retired; false otherwise

    • getCurrentSalary

      public int getCurrentSalary()
      Returns the current salary of the player. Returns 0 if the player does not have a career yet.
      Returns:
      the current salary of the player

    • getCurrentTax

      public int getCurrentTax()
      Returns the current tax of the player. Returns 0 if the player does not have a career yet.
      Returns:
      the current tax of the player

    • getPayRaises

      public int getPayRaises()
      Returns the amount of pay raises the player has done already.
      Returns:
      the amount of pay raises the player has done already

    • getFamily

      public int getFamily()
      Returns the amount of family members the player currently has. This includes as well the spouse of the player.
      Returns:
      the amoung of family members a player has
